intro: Strobilanthes longzhouensis, commonly known as the Longzhou strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually blue or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
